meanings.definition: An excessively alkaline condition of the body fluids or tissues.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with alkalosis after analyzing the blood pH levels.
meanings.sent2: Alkalosis can occur when there is a loss of acid from the body, leading to an imbalance.
meanings.sent3: The alkalosis in the fish tank made the water so basic that the fish started to feel like they were swimming in soap.
meanings.sent4: Her positivity was like an alkalosis, spreading through the office and lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The alkalosis in the soil caused the plants to grow rapidly, thriving in the nutrient-rich environment.

meanings.sent1: During the experiment, the alkalosis of the solution was carefully monitored to track the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent2: The gradual alkalosis of the lake water was a result of the limestone deposits dissolving over time.
meanings.sent3: The alkalosis of the batter made the cake rise so much that it almost touched the oven ceiling.
meanings.sent4: As she spoke, her words seemed to undergo an alkalosis, becoming more soothing and calming with each sentence.
meanings.sent5: The alkalosis of the paint mixture created a vibrant hue that brightened up the entire room.
